TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant [ Mr PERSON ] is a NORP national born in DATE . He is a regular officer in the NORP army and lives at PERSON ( in the département of Var ) . He has lodged CARDINAL other applications with ORG : application no . CARDINAL , on which the ORG gave judgment on DATE ( NORP v. GPE , judgment of DATE , Reports of Judgments and Decisions CARDINALVI ) , and application no . ORG , which the ORG declared inadmissible on DATE .
He was represented by PERSON , of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . At the material time the applicant held the rank of captain . He was in command of the first company ( “ the company ” ) of ORG ( “ CARDINALnd GPE ) and was based in LOC .
CARDINAL . On DATE the company set off on a “ provincial tour ” to the GPE region in the north of LOC .

On DATE the applicant called together the heads of platoon and told them that poachers had been reported to him in the presidential reserve and NORP - Bangoran FAC and that they were to carry out an “ unofficial ” investigation mission . He designated CARDINAL areas ; CARDINAL platoon of the company , under the applicant 's command , was to investigate in CARDINAL of them and a second platoon , under the command of Lieutenant C. , was to investigate in the other . A third platoon was to relieve the second after TIME . The applicant said that any poachers encountered should be intercepted and , if they fled , should if necessary be fired on after a warning had been given . The operation began on TIME DATE .

On DATE a patrol from the second platoon , commanded by Staff PERSON , came upon CARDINAL natives who fled on seeing them . Staff PERSON fired two shots , wounding one of the fugitives in the leg . On hearing of the incident from ORG , PERSON went to the scene with the platoon 's medical orderly , Corporal J. The injured man was treated and taken to the bivouac , where PERSON ordered Corporal NORP to dig a grave . TIME after that had been done , and after being questioned , the captive , on PERSON orders , was “ finished off ” by means of CARDINAL shots fired by Corporal NORP and then buried .

CARDINAL . The applicant was told of the incident on CARDINAL or DATE and ordered his men to remain silent . They returned to their camp at ORG on DATE . In his report on the “ provincial tour ” the applicant made no mention of any incident .

CARDINAL . When questioned on DATE by Lieutenant - Colonel PERSON , the commanding officer of the NORP operational assistance units ( “ the ORG ” ) in PERSON , who had heard rumours of an incident during the tour , the applicant and PERSON said that they had found a native 's body , had buried it and had not reported the matter out of discretion . They drew up reports relating this version of the events . ORG authorities were informed on DATE and no further inquiries were made .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE , however , Colonel PERSON , the commanding officer of the ORG in LOC , was told that evidence given to the LOC police implicated his soldiers . He therefore decided to recommence the inquiry and on CARDINAL May personally interviewed the applicant , PERSON , Staff PERSON and Corporal PERSON The applicant and PERSON confirmed the content of their original reports . As their statements differed in some respects , however , Colonel PERSON interviewed PERSON again . The lieutenant then admitted that Staff PERSON had opened fire on the poacher , who had been injured in the leg and had received medical treatment at the scene of the incident . He also said that the captive had died from his injuries shortly after being taken to the bivouac and that he himself had ordered that he should be buried at once .

CARDINAL . On his return to Bangui with the applicant and PERSON Colonel PERSON had the matter reported to the ORG Chief of Staff . On CARDINAL DATE the Chief of Staff told the colonel that he had been in touch with the prosecutor at ORG , that an application should be made to the ORG military police – a gendarmerie detachment assigned during operations to a large unit or base to carry out general policing and criminal - investigation duties – and that the company was to be relieved as soon as possible .

CARDINAL . In a commanding - officer report of CARDINAL DATE Colonel ORG said that he believed PERSON latest statement on the circumstances of the poacher 's death . He also set out the facts described above ( see paragraphs CARDINAL ) , concluded that the applicant was “ wholly ” responsible and asked for disciplinary penalties to be imposed on him ( replacement as head of his unit and a reprimand by the Minister of Defence ) and on PERSON DATE confinement ) . The report stated , inter alia : “ ... from the evidence obtained in the course of this inquiry it may be concluded that Captain Serves ... was wholly responsible . He acted outside the scope of his duties , breached instructions and issued orders conflicting with those he had received concerning the use of weapons and ammunition . ... As an officer in command of a ORG unit , he knew that in giving such orders he would be blindly obeyed . Moreover , although he was aware of the events , he did not report them and sought to conceal the facts , ordering his men to remain completely silent . ”

CARDINAL . The soldiers involved in the case were sent back to GPE on CARDINAL DATE . The applicant , PERSON , Staff PERSON and Corporal PERSON were held at ORG in the département of FAC . Together with the other CARDINAL heads of platoon in the unit , they were questioned on CARDINAL , DATE and CARDINAL DATE by General PERSON , the commanding officer of ORG and ORG . In his commanding - officer report of CARDINAL DATE to the ORG Chief of Staff he mentioned a rumour that the poacher had been “ finished off ” by Corporal NORP and concluded that PERSON and the applicant bore the responsibility , which was “ weighty ” in the latter 's case . The report stated that “ in sending his company off on this stupid ' poacher - hunting ' expedition [ the applicant had taken ] the enormous risk of a ' blunder ' of [ that ] kind ” and that by “ subsequently distorting the truth and ordering his entire unit to keep quiet or to tell lies he [ had ] made matters considerably worse for himself ” , adding that “ the courts will establish the precise degree of his guilt ; as far as his commanding officers are concerned , he does not deserve any leniency ” .

On DATE General PERSON questioned the applicant , Staff PERSON , Corporal J. and Lieutenant C. again . PERSON admitted that Corporal NORP had , on his orders , shot the injured man in order to “ put an end to the suffering of a dying man ” . This was later confirmed by the corporal . A commanding - officer report of DATE gives an account of this and concludes : “ The facts which I have reported seem to me to be credible at this stage . In any event , it would appear difficult for me to pursue my investigations now that most of the protagonists are being dealt with by the courts . Keeping deliberately within the strict confines of the commanding - officer inquiry , I confirm that the responsibility lies mainly , as I have already stated , with the CARDINAL officers in question . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE Colonel PERSON had informed the commandant of the Bangui military police of the facts of the case . The commandant had opened a preliminary inquiry and on CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE sent messages to the prosecutor at ORG , reading as follows :

“ First : investigation being carried out by commanding officer of Bangui military police detachment ( CAR ) assisted by Bangui and PERSON military police personnel [ ; ] pending proceedings do not require soldiers in question to be detained here in view of line taken by Head of ORG .
Second : all personnel involved will have made statements before returning to GPE .
Third : personnel concerned will depart for ORG with their unit on DATE ... ”
and
“ Further to telephone call DATE CARDINAL DATE , names of soldiers implicated in the case are
( CARDINAL ) Serves , PERSON , Captain .
( CARDINAL ) [ C. ] , Lieutenant .
( CARDINAL ) [ B. ] , Staff Sergeant .
( CARDINAL ) [ J. ] , Corporal .
Unable at present to give you detailed account of facts . Information currently being sought .

Please ask PERSON [ ORG Chief of Staff ] to make arrangements with ORG Bangui for soldiers in question to be conveyed to GPE . Request message confirming instructions you gave by telephone and possibly also fresh orders – even at once orally . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the commandant of the military police interviewed Colonel PERSON , who had given him a copy of his report of DATE An official report of CARDINAL May , to which the colonel 's report and the record of his interview were annexed , brought the investigation to an end .
CARDINAL . On an application of CARDINAL DATE by the prosecutor at ORG an investigation was begun in respect of the applicant , PERSON , Staff PERSON and Corporal J.
On DATE the applicant was charged with manslaughter , and on DATE a murder charge was substituted . He was detained pending trial from DATE to CARDINAL DATE .

Lieutenant C. and Corporal NORP were also charged with murder , and CARDINAL other legionnaires , from the company 's second platoon , were charged with aiding and abetting murder ; Corporal PERSON was charged with manslaughter and Staff PERSON with wounding with intent or wilful violence or assault , entailing or not unfitness for work for not DATE and committed with a weapon .
CARDINAL . On DATE , on an application by the prosecutor , ORG of ORG , exercising jurisdiction as the body supervising military judicial investigations , gave the following judgment :
The body supervising the judicial investigation

Notes that the investigation was commenced on an application of CARDINAL DATE made without the opinion of the Minister of Defence or of the authority referred to in LAW having first been obtained as required by LAW .

PERSON that this irregularity , seeing that the offenders were not caught in the act , had the effect of infringing the rights of those against whom proceedings have been brought , and that at the same time they were also not afforded a fair hearing as some of the evidence from the preliminary inquiry had not been placed in the file .
Consequently declares void the application of CARDINAL DATE for a judicial investigation and the steps subsequently taken in the proceedings .
Declares that the preliminary inquiry and the messages of [ CARDINAL ] and CARDINAL DATE remain effective .

CARDINAL . NORP In response to a request from the prosecutor on DATE , the Minister of Defence issued an opinion on DATE in which he stated that the facts appeared to constitute a serious crime ( crime ) and that criminal proceedings should be brought .

CARDINAL . On an application of CARDINAL DATE by the prosecutor ( which referred to the official report of CARDINAL DATE , the messages of CARDINAL and DATE , General PERSON 's commanding - officer reports of CARDINAL May and DATE and the Minister of Defence 's opinion ) , a judicial investigation , for murder , was begun in respect of PERSON Corporal NORP only . They were charged on DATE .
CARDINAL . In connection with that investigation , the military investigating judge took evidence from Colonel PERSON , Lieutenant - Colonel PERSON and Staff PERSON , among others .

The applicant was likewise summoned to appear as a witness , on CARDINAL , DATE and DATE ; on each occasion he attended but refused to take the oath and give evidence . On the same dates the investigating judge consequently ordered him to pay fines of MONEY ( ORG ) , ORG CARDINAL and ORG CARDINAL respectively . The applicant appealed against those orders to ORG of ORG . His main argument was that as , in its judgment of DATE , the ORG had expressly declared that the preliminary inquiry and the messages of CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE on which his DATE charge had been based remained effective , there was incriminating evidence against him such as enabled him to be charged , so that he could not be examined as a witness without his defence rights being infringed and a breach of LAW being committed . ORG upheld the impugned orders in a judgment of DATE . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed an appeal on points of law by the applicant .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant was again charged with murder , and on DATE ORG of ORG indicted Corporal NORP for murder , and PERSON and the applicant for aiding and abetting murder .

CARDINAL . The hearing in the Paris Military Court was held on DATE . On DATE , having heard evidence from a large number of witnesses , including Colonel PERSON and General PERSON , the court convicted all CARDINAL defendants ; Corporal NORP was sentenced to DATE imprisonment , suspended , PERSON to DATE imprisonment , with DATE suspended , and the applicant to DATE imprisonment , with DATE suspended .
CARDINAL . The applicant and PERSON appealed on points of law against the judgments of DATE and CARDINAL DATE .

In a summary statement of his grounds of appeal of CARDINAL DATE the applicant relied in particular on LAW , alleging that his defence rights had been infringed by the addition of ORG reports to the case file , and that the proceedings as a whole had not been fair .
On DATE ORG delivered the following judgment , in which it dismissed the appeal :

“ ... In dismissing the objection that the prosecutor 's application of CARDINAL DATE for a judicial investigation was void because it referred to CARDINAL inquiry reports based on statements obtained , in breach of the rules of criminal procedure and the rights of the defence , from persons against whom proceedings had been brought , ORG stated that ' the fact that the report of the commanding - officer inquiry carried out in connection with separate administrative proceedings was added to the case file so that the parties could present argument on it can not invalidate the judicial proceedings , which alone are governed by LAW and LAW and that ' the application , which was partly based on the commanding - officer inquiry , can not be declared void ' .
In so holding , the body supervising the judicial investigation did not infringe the provisions relied on in the ground of appeal [ including LAW ] .
It follows that the ground of appeal can not be accepted . ...

In dismissing the application for the proceedings to be declared void on the grounds that the investigating judge should not have summoned the appellant to appear before him as a witness or have examined Corporal [ J. ] or Staff Sergeant [ B. ] in that capacity since they had all been implicated by the commanding - officer inquiry , and that certain statements set out in the order transferring the case for submission to ORG , concerning the length of time the accused had each spent in detention , were incorrect and had been taken from documents pertaining to the proceedings that had been declared void , the judges below noted in the first place that when PERSON was summoned before the investigating judge , the investigation had not yet established his precise role , and that it was not until DATE that , in the light of the evidence taken from a large number of witnesses and [ Lieutenant C. 's ] statements incriminating PERSON , the investigating judge considered that there was substantial , consistent evidence of his guilt such as to justify charging him .
They added that the examination of Corporal [ J. ] and Staff Sergeant [ B. ] as witnesses could not have invalidated the proceedings since no charges had been brought against either soldier .

Lastly , they found that the statements set out in the investigating judge 's order concerning PERSON detention pending trial had not been based on information taken from the documents that had been declared void but had been taken from the judgment declaring void the first application for a judicial investigation , and that Serves could not rely on inaccuracies concerning the situation of the other persons charged .

Given the nature of the statements , the body supervising the judicial investigation justified its decision without infringing the provisions relied on in the ground of appeal , which must therefore be dismissed . ... ”
